page.title: 06HEREFORD SIXTH FORM COLLEGE
page.content: This College was opened in 1973 when Comprehensive education was introduced in the City of Hereford. It was anticipated that 500 16 year old students from the local secondary schools would wish to continue their education at the College. The College, also on the Aylestone Campus, offers a wide variety of GCE A and O level courses and students are given full careers advice while at the College. Most students go on to tertiary education on leaving. The facilities are excellent, with a purpose built science block, two lecture theatres, a library, resources centre, Arts, Music, Languages, Mathematics and Computing Departments. A wide variety of extra curricular activites are catered for, often in association with the Technical College next door.
